issue.title: Add generic mock-adaptor
issue.body:
This adds a new `zorg.test` module which can be used to encompass any additional testing additions in the future. The only current occupant of this module is a new `MockAdaptor` class which is designed to make it easier to configure mock adaptors in tests for drivers.
- [x] Unit tests for test module
- [x] Update documentation

issue.title: Method for adding commands to robot
issue.body: Hi, I just found this project and I am trying to figure how to add commands to my robot. I see that there is individual commands for each device to do things like turn an led on or move a servo. Is there a way to add more complex command methods? I want to build a small robot that can drive around. It would be great if I could have a command such as "drive_forward" that takes the distance that it should drive.

issue.title: Support for Batty tests
issue.body:
Right now this adds initial, not-yet-complete support for [Batty](https://github.com/hybridgroup/batty) to the HTTP API provided by Zorg.

API responses
- MCP
  - [x] Add commands
  - [x] Add events
- Robots
  - [x] Add commands
  - [x] Add events
- Connections
  - [x] Add list
  - [x] Add detail
- Devices
  - [x] Add events
- Errors
  - [x] Correctly handle 404/500 status codes
  - [x] Add nicely formatted error messages

Zorg additions
- Adaptor
  - [x] Loopback adaptor
  - [x] Events using generators
- Drivers
  - [x] Ping driver
  - [x] Events using generators
- Events
  - [x] Event streams
  - [x] Polling event sources
  - [ ] Manually triggered events

Side notes
- Events must conform to the [EventSource specification](https://w3c.github.io/eventsource/).

issue.title: Add setup instructions
issue.body:
The gh-pages site needs instructions on how to get the code running on the Intel Edison. Ideally we would have three different sections for Windows, Mac, and Linux. The instructions need to cover installing the library, and creating a new project. It would also be great if we show how to connect to the Edison board using sftp so that you can use a text editor that isn't vi.
- [x] Linux setup instructions
- [x] Windows setup instructions
- [x] Mac setup instructions

issue.title: Add benefits description to home page
issue.body:
## Why use zorg?

Zorg wraps the mraa library created by intel for interacting with IO pins on the Edison microcontroller. mraa works great on its own, but the benefit of Using Zorg is that we have already created many of the drivers for using sensors and output devices. Zorg also implements multiprocessing so that tasks such as reading and writing from sensors are non-blocking and you can take full advantage of devices that have multiple processors.

Zorg allows you to leverage other awesome science libraries written in python such as Numpy, Scipy, and scikit to bring features such as computer vision and machine learning.
